          if there is more than one chow to make with a claimed tile, this method is used to disambiguate between the possibilities, by scoring the pattern that results from making each, and selecting the chow that matches the highest scoring pattern

protected  int processAI(int wallsize, int prevplayerhandsize)
          Because "this" is apparently an object-level identifier, even though private/protected are class-level identifiers, I need to have a wrapping function that allows me to have HumanPlayer very explicitly call super.process at the end of startOfTurnChecks() - even if I force HumanPlayer to call super.startOfTurnChecks in its own override on startOfTurnChecks, the call to process() will go to HumanPlayer.process() - REGARDLESS of whether or not I use "process()" or "this.process()" in Player (this class).

Player

public Player(java.lang.String name,
              PatternScorer patternscoring,
              Logger logger)
contructor - requires the name of the player, the handscoring object to be used for path planning, the patternscoring object to be used for path planning, and the logging object for file logging

Parameters:
name - player name
patternscoring - the PatternScorer object this player will use for score analysis
logger - the file logging object

bestDiscard

protected int bestDiscard(TilePattern pattern,
                          TilePattern difference,
                          RequiredTilePattern required)
This method determines which discard is the best choice this turn.

Parameters:
pattern - the "best" path pattern
difference - the difference pattern between the "best" path and the last known current hand
required - the requirement pattern for turning the last known current hand into the path pattern
Returns:
the tile that is best discarded or TilePattern.NOTILE if this hand is already a winning hand

checkBestChow

protected int[] checkBestChow(int tile)
if there is more than one chow to make with a claimed tile, this method is used to disambiguate between the possibilities, by scoring the pattern that results from making each, and selecting the chow that matches the highest scoring pattern

Parameters:
tile - the tile with which to make a chow
Returns:
an int[] array of three tiles representing the chow that has been selected

claim

protected void claim(int type)

claimHonored

public int claimHonored(int tile,
                        int wallsize,
                        int prevplayer)
                 throws RequireSupplementTileException
Let this player know it is allowed to pick up play by claiming a discard

Parameters:
tile - the tile that the player is allowed to claim
wallsize - the size of the wall, minus the dead wall
prevplayer - the number of the previous player [used in discard()]
Returns:
the tile that this player discards after the claim
Throws:
RequireSupplementTileException

used as a "reset"

discard

public int discard(int tile)
Discard a specific tile from the hand. This function returns the same tile as it receives as parameter, but does some processing that requires this number.

Parameters:
tile - the tile this player will be discarding
Returns:
the tile this player will be discarding

public int lookingFor(int tile,

wrapping function, which calls the TileAnalyser function by the same name.

Returns:
the integer representation of which set this player can use the available tile for

movetolocked

protected void movetolocked(int[] tiles)
this method moves tiles from the hand to the locked set. this occurs in sorter order and as such locked should NEVER be sorted by an external function like Arrays.sort()

Parameters:
tiles - the tiles that should be moved from the hand to the locked container

movetobonus

protected void movetobonus(int tile)
moves a bonus tile to the bonus array

Parameters:
tile - the tile to be moved to the bonus tile container

playturn

public int playturn(int drawntile,
                    int wallsize,
                    int prevplayer)
             throws RequireSupplementTileException
Process a normal play turn

Parameters:
drawntile - the tile this player received from the wall
wallsize - the number of tiles still in the wall, not counting the dead wall
prevplayer - the number of the player whose turn it was before this player
Returns:
a discarded tile number
Throws:
RequireSupplementTileException

process

public int process(int wallsize,
                   int prevplayerhandsize)
runs the AI process of analysing the hand, and determining which tiles are still required, and which can be discarded.

Parameters:
wallsize - the size of the available wall
prevplayerhandsize - the previous player, important for chow likelihood estimation
Returns:
the tile this player has chosen as discard

processAI

protected int processAI(int wallsize,
                        int prevplayerhandsize)
Because "this" is apparently an object-level identifier, even though private/protected are class-level identifiers, I need to have a wrapping function that allows me to have HumanPlayer very explicitly call super.process at the end of startOfTurnChecks() - even if I force HumanPlayer to call super.startOfTurnChecks in its own override on startOfTurnChecks, the call to process() will go to HumanPlayer.process() - REGARDLESS of whether or not I use "process()" or "this.process()" in Player (this class).

Parameters:
wallsize - size of the wall, minus deadwall
prevplayerhandsize - the number of the previous player
Returns:
the best discard for the current play pattern

public void recordWin()
tally a win for this player

public int scoreNormal(int windoftheround)
score this player's hand as a normal hand

Parameters:
windoftheround - the wind of the round
Returns:
the score this player's hand is under non-winning conditions

score this player's hand as a winning hand

Parameters:
windoftheround - the wind of the round
Returns:
the score this player's hand is as winning hand

                              int prevplayerhandsize)
                       throws RequireSupplementTileException

wantToKong

protected boolean wantToKong(int tile)
Determines whether we want to use a concealed pung for a concealed kong, or whether we'll pass up on it.

Parameters:
tile - the tile for which a kong can be made
Returns:
a commitment to playing a concealed kong

wantToMeld

protected boolean wantToMeld(int tile)
checks whether this player wants to meld a kong by mergin a drawn tile with a pung on the table

Parameters:
tile - the tile just drawn
Returns:
whether or not to meld a kong

won

protected boolean won(int tile)
safety check method, to determine whether we really did win.

Returns:
whether we won or not with our batch of tiles
